intro: Isodon atroruber, commonly known as the black-red isodon, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and a strong, mint-like fragrance. Its flowers are typically purple or violet, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Isodon atroruber is valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
